data.title: James Brokenshire ready to take on new challenge as communities secretary
data.meta_description: The Home Office has been the graveyard of many ministerial careers but it was the making of James Brokenshire, the new communities secretary.At the start of the Coalition government in 2010, Mr Brokenshire, 50, was appointed to the role he had shadowed in opposition — a junior post at the Home Offic
data.text:
The Home Office has been the graveyard of many ministerial careers but it was the making of James Brokenshire, the new communities secretary.

At the start of the Coalition government in 2010, Mr Brokenshire, 50, was appointed to the role he had shadowed in opposition — a junior post at the Home Office responsible for crime reduction. His good fortune was that Theresa May became home secretary at the same time. Mr Brokenshire stayed in the department under Mrs May until she became prime minister in 2016, moving first to the security brief then on to immigration.

Mr Brokenshire led talks with Jordan over the deportation of Abu Qatada, the radical preacher, and oversaw efforts to introduce laws combating modern slavery. Both issues are seen
